description: man in hooded cloak embracing and kissing a limp nude woman whose feet dangle in water; fire at left; building on top of cliff, ULC; moon partially hidden by clouds, URQ; woman's abdomen exposed
inscription:
Signature, Title and Inscription

bottom center, in the print: [....quelle Scene inouie! / ....sa Phrosine etoit évanouie;]; URC above image, printed in black: [Chant IV. Pag. 100.]; bottom center below image, printed in black: [Prud\'hon, inv. incidit.]
provenance: [Arsène Bonafous-Murat, Paris, until 1990; sold in June for Fr RTOO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1990-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in the print: [P. P. Prudhon. inv. incidit.]; ULC above image, printed in black: [Phrosine et Mélidore.]
title: Phrosine et Mélidore
